summary: Interactive romantic-themed single-page Valentine proposal web page for Aqsa Kousar (runs in Chrome on iPad) with Yes/No choices, evasive No button on hover, and a meme image reveal on Yes.
architectural_notes: Single static HTML/CSS/JS page intended to run locally in Chrome on iPad.
Add UI animations for buttons (CSS keyframes / JS-triggered effects) while keeping iPad Chrome performance in mind.
Support tap-to-toggle (or tap-to-advance) between two static image assets in the confirmation/photo view.
Consider adding a lightweight password prompt gate before rendering the main Valentine content (intended for iPad Chrome / static frontend).
Password gate should support setting both the correct password and a customizable hint message (static frontend).
known_issues: Password gate currently rejects the intended password (mismatch between expected "9102008" and the value coded in the app).

existing_features.title: Create a single, simple romantic-themed page addressed to “Aqsa Kousar” that asks: “Will you be my Valentine?” and presents exactly two options: “Yes” and “No”.
Implement an evasive “No” button that moves away when the user attempts to interact with it so it is effectively not clickable on both desktop (mouse hover) and iPad (touch interaction).

When the user clicks “Yes”, transition the UI to show a meme image that visually includes the text “Good choice” and display a clear confirmation state (e.g., hide the buttons or disable further interaction).
Apply a romantic pink-and-white visual theme across the page (background, typography, buttons, spacing) and ensure the layout is responsive and works well in Chrome on iPad.
Add the generated meme image as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and load it directly from the frontend (not via the backend).

Add the user-uploaded image file (IMG_20260210_031107_923.jpg) as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, and use it as the image shown in the Yes-confirmation state (the screen shown after clicking “Yes”).
Update frontend/src/App.tsx to point the Yes-confirmation src to the newly added static asset and update the alt text to describe the new image in English.
Add the newly uploaded image file (IMG_20260210_032555_590.jpg) as a static frontend asset under frontend/public/assets/generated, and reference it only from the frontend (no backend involvement).

In the Yes-confirmation view (the screen shown after clicking “Yes”), make the displayed photo tappable/clickable so that tapping the first photo toggles to the second photo (IMG_20260210_032555_590.dim_640x480.jpg), and tapping again toggles back to the first photo (the currently used IMG_20260210_031107_923.dim_1024x1536.jpg).

Make both the “Yes” and “No” buttons feel “very animated” with romantic vibes by adding noticeable but tasteful animations (idle + interaction states) while preserving the current behavior (Yes remains clickable; No remains evasive on hover/touch).
Add a video section to the Valentine proposal single-page UI so the user can play a romantic video directly within the page on iPad Chrome.
Add a local static video asset under frontend/public/assets/generated and wire the new video section to load it directly from the frontend (no backend involvement).
Remove the video section from the Valentine proposal page UI so no video player is rendered and no video-related user-facing text is shown.
Remove all frontend references to the local video asset so the app no longer requests or loads "/assets/generated/valentine-video.dim_1280x720.mp4".
Add a simple password gate so the Valentine page content (including the Yes/No buttons and the Yes-confirmation photo view) is not shown until the user enters the correct password.
Persist the unlocked state locally so the user does not need to re-enter the password on the next page refresh during the same browser session, and provide a way to lock the page again.
Update the password gate so the correct password is exactly "9102008" (instead of the currently coded value), and ensure entering "9102008" unlocks the Valentine page content.
Update the password screen hint text to exactly: "Hint: The most happiest day for me."

new_feature_requests.summary: Build a simple romantic Valentine proposal web page addressed to Aqsa Kousar using HTML/CSS/JS (pink/white theme) runnable in Chrome on iPad.
Provide Yes/No buttons where the No button moves away on hover to prevent clicking, effectively forcing a Yes selection.
On clicking Yes, display a meme image with the text "Good choice" (or equivalent confirmation message).
Replace the current displayed meme/confirmation image with a different user-provided picture (swap the static asset used on the Yes confirmation state).
Add more romantic, noticeable animations to the Yes/No buttons (enhanced animated/romantic vibes on interaction).
Enable tapping the first photo to switch/transition to a second photo (image toggle on tap in the Yes/confirmation view).
Add a simple password gate so the Valentine page/link only opens after entering the correct password.
Update the password gate to accept the intended password "9102008" (currently incorrectly set to a different value).
Update the password screen hint text to: "The most happiest day for me."

projectName: Romantic Valentine proposal single-page with evasive No button and meme reveal
